title: 010000.org
description_cn: 本项目探讨当代社会中买卖关系在不可预知的时间框架下的表现，并结合神学和佛教的时间观念。它旨在突出存在的短暂性，并通过数字媒介建立时间观念的概念表现。
description_en: This project explores the buyer-seller relationship in contemporary society within an unpredictable time frame, drawing on theological and Buddhist concepts of time. It aims to highlight the transient nature of existence and establish a conceptual representation of time through the digital medium.

title: Hanging on the chain
description_en: In 2018, I put a quote on the chain through an ethereum transaction, and in 2021 I try to put the LINK representing this transaction on the NFTs' platform for trading; have we reached a point where the transaction alone can be seen as value, or even that the transaction is art?

materials: Ink, sponge roller / 油墨、海绵滚轮
description_en: 404 is the error message which appears on blocked websites in China. Translating the digital message back into analog form, 404 (2017) is aaajiao’s subtle commentary on censorship and the flow of information in our digital culture. The message is always the same, no matter the diversity of content it is covering from view. Entirely site-specific, this work takes a new form with each installation; multiplying the message 404 in a diversity of forms and contexts. - DR. RACHEL RITS-VOLLOCH

title: Permanent magnet spheres
description_en: This artwork features permanent magnet spheres in variable dimensions, serving as a permanent installation. It explores themes of magnetism and form in a physical space.

title: A Dead Innovative Company
materials: USB installation (automatic font file copy to plug in the usb flash drive), data of xindanwei, text
description_cn: 一个探索技术与创新相互作用的多媒体装置。此作品使用户能够与 USB 驱动器交互，插入后自动复制字体文件，代表数字与物理领域的融合。
description_en: A multimedia installation exploring the interplay between technology and innovation. This work allows users to engage with USB drives that automatically copy font files upon insertion, representing the fusion of digital and physical realms.

title: A.I. Goooooooooogle infiltration
title_cn: 人工智能, Goooooooooogle 渗透
description_cn: 该作品是与许聪共同完成。作品基于谷歌的AVA程序，利用并批判人工智能在感知和人类与机器互动中的角色。该装置由十个屏幕组成，展示一些日常动作，由AI标记，揭示数据在我们生活中潜在的影响。
description_en: This piece was done in collaboration with XuCong. The work bases on Google’s AVA program, which utilizes and critiques AI's role in sensory perception and human interaction with machines. The installation consists of ten screens displaying mundane actions tagged by AI, revealing the hidden influence of data in our lives.

title: A bit, A prompt
description_cn: 在无限膨胀的运算力（权力）面前，我们每一个人都可能成为仅拥有微弱算力的少数群体，如果我们聚焦当下最接近可见的运算力的互联网，人们的行为正在被注意力经济下的平台算法以及无处不在的意识形态混战而异化成为了一个bit，闪烁跳动。运算力裹挟着社交媒体塞满了整个互联网并且正在以生成式ai的形式迅速蔓延到几乎所有领域，我尝试在展览中去找寻在如此的系统面前，是否存在缝隙，互联网的缝隙，缝隙中依旧流淌着解离系统权威，抚慰伤痛，化解仇恨的溪流。
description_en: For his exhibition with the gallery, Chinese Berlin based artist aaajiao seeks to face the infinitely expanding authority of computational power, and how its recent forms train us to have only feeble computing capabilities. Focusing on the internet, our closest and most visible form of computational power, aaajiao realizes works of art which track how people's behaviours are alienated from real life by the platform algorithms of the attention economy and the proliferation of pervasive ideological conflicts, turning life into merely an information bit, flickering and dancing. In the exhibition, aaajiao searches through the creation of video, paintings and sculpture for a void in such a system, for a void of the internet, where streams may still flow which dissociate from systemic authority, soothe our wounds, and dissolve these constructed configurations of distraction and hatred.

title: Deep Simulator
materials: Gaming station, surreal objects, computational power system
description_cn: 《深渊模拟器》是中国艺术家aaajiao在伦敦Tabula Rasa画廊举办的个展。本次展览展出了一台游戏台和超现实的雕塑，邀请观众探索现实与虚拟交融的空间。展览探讨了“深渊游荡者”的概念，这是一个集合了展览观众和游戏玩家的混合人格，允许他们在挑战新技术与数字数据背景下的现实观念时，逐步理解存在的更深层次真理。该展览最初为2020年意大利里沃利城堡概念化，此次在伦敦的展出希望能让更多观众体验到此作品。
description_en: Deep Simulator is a solo exhibition by the Chinese artist aaajiao, held at Tabula Rasa Gallery London. This exhibition features a gaming station and surreal objects resembling tree branches, inviting viewers to explore a space that merges the real and virtual. It explores the concept of the 'Deep Wanderer,' a hybrid persona that encapsulates the exhibition's observers and players, allowing them to grasp deeper truths about existence while challenging notions of reality within the context of new technologies and digital data. Initially conceived for Castello di Rivoli in 2020, this exhibition hopes to reach a broader audience in London after being restricted to domestic visitors in Italy due to the pandemic.

title: Agent
materials: Acrylic, flexible screen, Raspberry Pi player, microphone
description_en: "Agent" borrows proprietary terms from the Large language model (LLM) document or the Cookie Book as their titles. Additionally, I have created a fictional character named "Internet void" in the livd2d format to serve as the protagonist of the video installations. The character draws inspiration from the fact that fungi are independent from plants, animals, and other eukaryotes, cannot perform photosynthesis, and, like plants, cannot move but can extend their habitat through the growth of mycelium and can spread over long distances through spores produced by sexual or asexual reproduction. This serves as a visual interpretation of the "Internet void." The installation "Agent," composed of two flexible screens, discusses the relationship between hallucinations created by AI algorithms in graphic generation and human imagination.

title: Avatar
description_cn: 巴掌大的录像装置《头像》循环播放着一张似曾相识的gif头像。大颗粒像素肖像，他／她的头发在风中飘拂，他／她的性格因此得以伸张，情绪获得表达。就像众多应用中的用户以类似gif动画定义自己在虚拟世界的化身一样，《头像》也是为这个集体创作的一部无名“自画像”。
description_en: Framed in a palm-size, delicate, old-fashioned screen, this pixelated GIF animation of a teenage girl in a gust of wind (“Avatar”) translates the typical but precise social media cuteness and solitude into an anonymous portrait of a collective of users.

title: BDSQ
description_en: A project titled BDSQ that incorporates datamoshing techniques and features elements inspired by '北斗の拳 ケンシロウVSサウザー 決着'. This piece reflects a unique blend of technology and visual artistry.

title: BDSQ II
description_en: A single-channel video installation that operates for 4 minutes and 4 seconds.

title: BDSQ III
materials: acrylics painting on PMMA, metal material
description_en: A media sculpture featuring a unique blend of acrylic painting applied on PMMA and metal materials. The dimensions are 180cm x 130cm.

title: Berlin Wall sound collection project
description_en: A sound collection project created by aaajiao, with sound by yao yuan and hardwave by aaajiao and majian.

title: Blog Archaeology
materials: Metal structure, acrylic, electronic weigher/ 亚克力，电子秤，金属结构
description_cn: 收集十年（1999-2008）RobotWisdom.com的网站数据，称量每年的数据重量。
description_en: Collect the website data of RobotWisdom.com for ten years (1999-2008) and weigh the annual data weight.

title: Body Shadow
description_cn: aaajiao乃以高安秀树关于分形理论的经典著作《分数维》（1986）为出发点，他将现代分形理论、计算机算法贯穿至他对中医的经络研究中。Aaajiao的这组现场作品集合了装置、摄影、录像等媒介，通过对人体的扫描，算法的解读，将人体内无形的能量场域外化进展览现场，并转译成为文身图案。
description_en: aaajiao’s latest videos, photographs, and installations inspired by Hideki Takayasu’s 1986 book “Furakutaru” (Fractals in Physical Science [Nonlinear science: theory & application]). Over the past years, aaajiao has been researching for a series of comparative studies between the theory of fractals and Chinese philosophy (and medical science). His algorithmic methodology enables him to scan human body and track a new set of meridian systems. Combining these algorithms with art of tattoo, he transplants this internal micro-universe into the gallery space. This attempt to represent the energy sources, by outlining these ever-changing and active channels, also portrays unanticipated aspects of the personality of individuals.

title: CROSSING STORIES
materials: Nintendo devices, Animal Crossing: New Horizons game
description_cn: 每周邀请一位动森玩家(集合啦！動物森友會)来$$$$岛上和我交换故事, 任何故事都可以. 准备工作, 需要拥有集合啦！動物森友會游戏以及Nintendo设备, 以及加入Nintendo会员确保可以进行互联网联机, 另外请安装 Nintendo Switch Online app方便打字或者语音。
description_en: Invite one Animal Crossing (New Horizons) player to come to $$$$ Island each week and swap stories with me, any story will do. Prep work, need to own Animal Crossing: New Horizons game and Nintendo devices, as well as joining Nintendo members, ensure that you can connect to the Internet, and Please install the Nintendo Switch Online app for easy typing and voice.

title: Candy Wrappers
materials: Single channel video, color; screen, cables / 单频彩色录像、屏幕、线
description_cn: 一件单频彩色录像作品，通过多彩画面和抽象表现的视角探索了数字浏览的主题，灵感来源于Chrome扩展程序'Abstract Browsing'。
description_en: A single channel video work that explores the themes of digital browsing through the lens of colorful visuals and abstract representations inspired by the Chrome Extension 'Abstract Browsing'.

title: Cave
materials: 挤塑板, 天然松香, PVC, 金箔, 3d树枝打印件, 轻质粘土 / extruded board, natural rosin, PVC, gold leaf, 3d branch print, light clay
description_cn: 《洞穴》是与WLL和沈赳赳共同创作的装置作品，探讨物质和空间维度，以创造沉浸式体验。
description_en: Cave is an installation created in collaboration with WLL and Shen Jiujiu. It engages with both material and spatial dimensions to create an immersive experience.

title: Climate Bits
description_en: Concept: aaajiao by 史莱姆引擎SLIME ENGINE. This work reflects on the fragmentation of climate data through an interactive web format.

title: Cave Simulator
materials: polyurethane foam, LED installation, data visualization materials
description_cn: AIKE荣幸呈现aaajiao个展《洞穴模拟器》，此次将集中展出其近三年的全新创作，展期将于2020年5月2日持续至2020年6月21日。今年，aaajiao把创作线索聚焦在“玩家”这一由科技、互联网和虚拟维度赋予个体的新身份上。本次展览展示了aaajiao对当前生活状态的观察，探索人们生活在一个模拟器中的概念，展现了个体如何既是玩家，也是控制者。展览力求提供丰富的观展体验，旨在引发观众对材料和痕迹的认知，而不仅限于视觉结果。作品展示了aaajiao近期对材料的研究，利用聚氨酯泡沫素材创造出自然痕迹，激发观众对其形成过程的想象。
description_en: AIKE is delighted to present aaajiao's solo exhibition "Cave Simulator", consisting of the artist's new works over the last three years. The exhibition will open on May 2 and will be on view until June 21, 2020. This year, aaajiao shifts the focus of his practice on the "player", an identity any individual could claim as a result of data technology, the Internet, and the advent of virtual dimensions. The exhibition presents aaajiao’s insight on the present conditions of life, exploring the idea that people live in a simulator where everyone can be both a player and a simulator. The engagement in a simulated state allows one to grasp vulnerability, and the exhibition aims to provide a diverse viewing experience rather than limiting the audience to mere visual outcomes. It showcases aaajiao’s recent material studies, utilizing polyurethane foam that adopts natural surface marks to provoke imagination about their formations.

title: Cloud.data
materials: 12 × screen, acrylic, mirror algorithm for cloud, water
description_cn: 在作品《云》中，12块冰冷的纯平显示器模拟出了一小片昏暗的天空。与此同时，这个矩阵却也在数字时空中为我们营造了一片无边无垠的三维天空。由艺术家（或者更准确的说，是由计算机程序语言）生成的“白云”在虚拟空际缓慢漂过……那我们究竟该怎么去感知一个虚拟物体的质地、色彩、维度，甚至是温度呢？显然，我们目前还必须依赖知识（对现代数字化技术的了解）来做出判断。但或许在不久的将来，人体将能够“模拟”出某种“第六感”，使我们更好的去感知“数字时空”。
description_en: In his latest piece Cloud, 12 flat and cold screens simulate a small region of a dark sky, but in the other way this matrix is able to contain a boundless 3-dimension sky of a digital reality. Clouds generated by the artist’s computing language are seen flying over the screens… So how do we feel the textile dimension, the color, or even temperature…of a virtual object? Apparently, we very much rely on the knowledge understanding of the technology application, but maybe in the not far future, a sixth sense will finally be stimulated in human body to deal with the cyber reality.

title: Collective Behavior
description_cn: 作品是与声音艺术家谭硕欣共同完成。
description_en: A collaboration of sound artist Tan Shuoxin.

title: Cloud.data
description_en: Using computer algorithms to recreate natural processes, aaajiao created a series of clouds floating on LCD screens. The portability of the medium (liquid crystal display being the new scroll painting, as it were) is negated by either fastening the screens to suspended girders or placing them on concrete plinths. These pieces simultaneously engage the massive construction projects going on across China (with that, the wanton destruction of traditional neighborhoods) and the peaceful contemplation seen in traditional Chinese painting and writing. They also represent the exciting modes of cultural transmission in the contemporary world. At once, these pieces evoke Alfred Stieglitz’s Equivalents and sculptural Minimalism. Liam Gillick, in describing the work of Donald Judd, puts it nicely. “You are not supposed to fixate on the structures in isolation or to over rationalise them within the late modernist tendency towards reduction. The work functions best when it is allowed to hover between its connection to its given location and the rest of the relative experience we bring to the room.”

title: Column / 柱
description_cn: 作品是与刘晓光共同完成。身份的焦虑促使我们找到了新的角色 — 用户，以此身份为背景，利用图形学编程软件在桌面上绘制一座柱，每绘制一块就修改一次电脑系统时间，既可以前往未来，也可以回溯历史。虽然计算机的系统时间看似无限，但实际上却被开发者出于整体考虑做了限制 (OS X，1969–2038)，一种无限又有限的矛盾状态正是我们处于身体和媒体交融瞬间的现实心境。
description_en: A collaboration with Liu Xiaoguang. Anxieties over identity have prompted us to find a new role: the user. With this identity as background, we used a graphics processing software to draw a column; each time we finished a section we would modify the computer system time — it could head towards the future, and so it could trace back in history. But the computer’s sense of time that seems infinite has to do with a limitation we programmed based on an overall evaluation (1969-2038, OS X), and this state of conflict between the finite and the infinite is precisely the psychological reality we experience the moment the body and media melt together.

title: Consensus, geopolitics, chain, battery
materials: LCD screen, acrylic fittings ／ LCD显示器，压克力组件
description_cn: 该艺术作品通过LCD屏幕上的视觉和听觉体验探讨共识、地缘政治和技术依赖之间的交集。
description_en: This artwork explores the intersection of consensus, geopolitics, and technological dependencies through a visual and auditory experience on an LCD screen.

title: Poetic Daily
materials: 3×video 2′47′‘ 3′38′’ 2′41′‘, concept : aaajiao, computer graphics, video editing : aaajiao
description_en: This installation features a thematic exploration of art that challenges societal constraints, presented in the Art Beijing 2009 Exhibition.

title: Cube.Cell
materials: Concept: aaajiao, Yang2; Sound: Yang2; Software: aaajiao; Hardware: Majian
description_en: Cube.Cell is a mixed media installation by artist aaajiao showcasing a unique interplay between sound, software, and visual elements. This work reflects on the nature of urban spaces and human interaction within them.

title: Cube.data
description_en: Cube.data is a video or live performance created by aaajiao and yang2. It features concept by aaajiao and yang2, sound by yang2, and is produced with computer graphics and video editing by aaajiao.

title: DataSpectrogram
description_en: A spectrogram is a time-varying spectral representation that shows how the spectral density of a signal varies with time. Also known as spectral waterfalls, sonograms, voiceprints, or voicegrams, spectrograms are used to identify phonetic sounds, to analyse the cries of animals; they were also used in many other fields including music, sonar/radar, speech processing, seismology, etc. The instrument that generates a spectrogram is called a spectrograph.

title: Deep Simulator
description_en: On the occasion of the annual illy Prize and in conjunction with Artissima, the Castello di Rivoli Museo d’Arte Contemporanea presents the exhibition of the Chinese artist aaajiao (Xi’an, Shaanxi, 1984) Deep Simulator, 2020, a new multimedia installation designed specifically for the Manica Lunga project room of the Castello di Rivoli. The exhibition is curated by Marianna Vecellio. Enriched by modern thought developed around the Internet sphere, his practice explores the evolution of the identity of the human being assimilated by the digital world, with special attention to the concepts of representation and simulation. His works narrate the experiences of the new generation, accustomed to inhabiting the parallel worlds and saturated realities of the net. At the same time, the artist also looks at the countless possibilities offered by the digital and the numerous questions raised by this hyper-technologization. The installation presents a space at once both real and virtual: a new multimedia installation composed of an environment – a room set up with a gaming station and surreal elements on the wall evocative of tree branches designed by a digital algorithm – and a metagame. The main character of the installation is the 'Deep Wanderer', a figure that incorporates the physical person, the viewer of the exhibition, the player sitting at the gaming station and, lastly, the wanderer who takes shape in the net and starts off a metaphorical journey into the depths of its space.

title: Deep Simulator
description_cn: 深渊模拟器是一种元游戏，探索不同的游戏工具，使个人能够体验改变状态和人生、创造力与现实的新视角。
description_en: Deep Simulator is a metagame that explores different playful instruments that allow individuals to experience altered states and perspectives on life, creativity, and reality.

title: Diaspora as History
description_en: 'Diaspora as History' explores the senses and sentiments of the artist, aaajiao, who grapples with identity as a person navigating cultural and national origins. The work reflects on the complexities of Chineseness and the evolution of identity in a digital age, drawing from personal narratives and broader socio-political landscapes. Through vivid visual storytelling, aaajiao aims to address themes of mobility, belonging, and the impact of the internet on personal identity.

title: Email Trek
type: Video installation, website / 视频装置, 网站
materials:
-17' LED screen / 17 寸LED 屏幕
-PC sheet with UV print / 耐力板UV 打印
description_cn: 邮件迷航预言了邮件系统崩塌之后我们如何寻找还存在的邮件的一种想像。这个作品是与圈圈共同完成。
description_en: Email Trek describes the email system and how connections between people are lost when an email system is abandoned or ceases to exist. This work is like a prophecy. We use an automatically generated email address (https://rstudio-pubsstatic.s3.amazonaws.com/24678_8234c8 01b4134f2cb32d8077f6cd75a2.html) to find valid emails. It's like a 'Star Trek', searching out life in the universe. For us, a valid email address is evidence of life.

title: EmbeddedProject
materials: Concept: aaajiao, wang zhenfei, wang luming; Interactive: aaajiao, liu xiaoguang; Computer graphics: aaajiao, wang zhenfei; Architecture: wang zhenfei, wang luming (HHD_FUN)
description_en: EmbeddedProject is an architectural project developed by aaajiao, wang zhenfei, and wang luming, receiving recognition with the Third Prize at CA’ASI 2010. This project includes elements of interaction and computer graphics, blending technology and architectural design.

title: Eyes Fur
materials: made possible with the collaboration of Xu Cong and WLL. / 作品是与许聪和WLL共同完成。

title: Fabric, computational wind, OCD, search
title_cn: 织物，计算风，强迫症，搜寻
materials: LCD screen, acrylic fittings ／ LCD显示器，压克力组件
description_cn: 一个视频装置，探讨了织物与风的计算模拟之间的关系，反映了艺术家对搜索算法的强迫症。
description_en: A video installation that explores the relationship between fabric and computational simulations of wind, reflecting the artist's obsession with search algorithms.

title: Faceing system
description_en: aaajiao solo exhibition: cybernetics. Size screen part 24*28*20cm aluminium part 205*38*13.8cm. Technical support: shen jiujiu.

title: Fine-tuning
materials: Acrylic, custom screen, Raspberry Pi player, microphone
description_en: "Fine-tuning" borrows proprietary terms from the Large language model (LLM) document or the Cookie Book as their titles. Additionally, I have created a fictional character named "Internet void" in the livd2d format to serve as the protagonist of the video installations. The character draws inspiration from the fact that fungi are independent from plants, animals, and other eukaryotes, cannot perform photosynthesis, and, like plants, cannot move but can extend their habitat through the growth of mycelium and can spread over long distances through spores produced by sexual or asexual reproduction. This serves as a visual interpretation of the "Internet void." "Fine-tuning" deconstructs the definition of fine-tuning in the application of LLM by documenting the manual adjustment of the character's facial and body parameters (craftsmanship) during the character creation process.

title: Free will, open mic, GFW, confessions
title_cn: 自由意志，开放麦，墙，告解
description_cn: 探讨自由意志和自我表达主题的视频装置。
description_en: A video installation exploring themes of free will and self-expression.

title: GFWlist
materials: stainless steel, thermal printer module, thermal paper
description_cn: 实际测量GFW的长度 。
description_en: Measuring the length of the GFW in reality.

title: Gluttony
description_cn: 2018年1月6日，千高原艺术空间的1000+实验项目空间将启动新年的第一个计划，带来艺术家aaajiao的个人项目“暴食”。千高原的实验项目空间以新锐艺术家的实验性创作为主，不追求作品与主题的成熟度或完整性，而是以更加开放的姿态，探索创作与展示的可能性，并努力带来特殊的观展体验。aaajiao的创作结合了浓重的反乌托邦意识，以及对文人精神的反思。他的很多作品都致力于探索新的科技和媒体影响之下的文化与社会现象。作品涵盖了社交媒体写作，数据处理，以及网络和移动媒介下的新美学景观，将今天中国特殊的社交媒体文化和科技带入了国际艺术的讨论当中。
description_en: On 06.01.2018, the 1000+ Experimental Project Space of A Thousand Plateaus Art Space will launch the first new-year plan with a solo project - "Gluttony" from the artist Aaajiao. Instead of pursuing the maturity and integrity, this Experimental Project Space focuses on the experimental composition of emerging artists with a more open attitude to explore the possibility of the creation and presentation and to strive for a unique exhibition experience. Aaajiao, is the pseudonym of the young artist Xu Wenkai and the avatar of his virtual network. He was born in 1984 in one of China’s oldest cities, Xi’an, but now lives and works in Shanghai and Berlin. The composition of Aajiao contains a strong dystopian awareness and a profound reflection on literati spirits and sophistications. Many of his works are devoted to the exploration of cultural and social phenomena around the influence of new technology and media. These works, ranging from social media writing and data processing to the new aesthetic landscape through the Internet and mobile media, bring the special Chinese social media culture and technology into international art discussions. In 2018, "Gluttony" will continue to explore how self as an observer gets along with the self devouring the pain through gluttony. This project is part of the "Membranization" series, exploring human emotions in relation to machines, where the rotten fermentations of social media are unable to capture emotional changes, but material combinations depict emotional contours.

title: Guard, I…
materials: silicone, fiberglass, artificial hair, clothing, seat
description_en: "Guard" is an installation artwork created using silicone, 3D printing, and fiberglass, depicting the figure of a security guard bearing the artist's own face. The inspiration for this piece comes from the unique role and circumstances of security guards in Chinese society during the COVID-19 lockdowns. During this period, security guards—typically individuals from lower socioeconomic backgrounds, veterans, or increasingly unemployed college graduates—were suddenly granted temporary authority by local governments. Empowered overnight, these guards rapidly transformed from community caretakers into authoritarian enforcers, imposing harsh and sometimes brutal measures upon the very residents they once served, resulting in numerous tragedies. The artist compares this months-long, severe lockdown to a "Stanford Prison Experiment" involving billions of people, using the artwork to explore the moral dilemmas and struggles of individuals under extreme authoritarian conditions. By placing his own face onto the security guard figure, the artist reflects upon his own potential complicity: if placed in an increasingly extreme environment, would he also be forced to don the guard's uniform, feign sleep, avoid confronting reality, or even become an executor of oppressive power? Through "Guard," the artist seeks to provoke contemplation on the human predicament under authoritarian rule, while also critically examining his own position as someone who has left Shanghai, now lives in Berlin, and holds the privilege of narrating the pains and traumas of this era.

title: HAL
description_en: IBM≠Heuristic ALgorithmic is a video by aaajiao, showcasing a runtime of 33'21'‘.

title: Guard, I…
materials: Silicone, resin 3D printing, artificial hair, clothing, seat / 硅胶，树脂3D打印，人造毛发，服装，座椅
description_cn:
以艺术家自身的面部与身体形态为蓝本，通过拍照结合 AI 算法生成粗模，再以传统工艺完成的一尊硅胶人偶。人偶身着常见的保安制服，坐在椅子上，仿佛在打盹。

在中国，保安曾经多由退伍军人或从乡村进城务工、年龄稍长的人担任。近几年，尤其是新冠疫情之后，保安也成了不少失业年轻人的选择，与保洁、保姆一起被戏称为“吉祥三宝”。简中互联网中还流行“年轻人当保安，少走四十年弯路”的迷因。瘟疫封城期间，居民大多被限制在居所与小区内，保安在行政口头授权下承担起“关键角色”，掌握出入与秩序管理等权限，成为小区层面“最小单位的法西斯”，也是很多被封居民的瘟疫创伤。与此同时，这份工作日常往往枯燥而孤独。许多年轻保安开始经营自媒体，拍 vlog 分享日常，希望借助全民注意力经济改善低收入处境并获得关注。
description_en:
Modeled on the artist’s own face and body, a rough form was generated via photography and AI, then finished by hand into a silicone figure. Dressed in a standard security uniform, the figure sits in a chair, as if drifting into a nap.

In China, security work was once largely taken by veterans and older rural migrants. Since the pandemic, it has also become a fallback for unemployed youth—jokingly grouped online with cleaners and nannies as the “Auspicious Three Treasures.” A meme on the Simplified-Chinese internet quips: “Young people becoming security guards, skipping forty years of detours.” During lockdowns, guards—under verbal administrative mandate—managed gates and order within residential compounds, becoming, at the scale of the neighborhood, “the smallest unit of fascism,” and a locus of trauma for many who were sealed in. Yet the work is often monotonous and solitary. Many young guards turned to personal channels and vlogs, hoping the attention economy might lift low wages and grant visibility.

title: GATE x SANKUANZ x aaajiao DIY "HTTP404" SET
description_en: "404 is the error message which appears on blocked websites in China. Translating the digital message back into analog form, 404 is aaajiao’s subtle commentary on censorship and the flow of information in our digital culture. The message is always the same, no matter the diversity of content it is covering from view. Entirely site-specific, this work takes a new form with each installation; multiplying the message 404 in a diversity of forms and contexts. Collaborative performance - Visitors will be directly involved in 404 painting the fabric on the wall with a special roller. The fabric will be then taken down and recycled into special t-shirts that will be part of something special and meaningful for a good cause. More info soon. Do it yourself - You will also be able to purchase a special DIY set during the event, composed of a small Roller, a blank tee and some ink in order to create your own 404.

title: Hard
description_cn: Isaac Asimov的The Three Laws of Robotics,通过污秽间隔(profanity delay)或“清除”(dump)按键的处理方式摧毁或是再造(产生歧异)The Three Laws of Robotics的理论。
description_en: Isaac Asimov's The Three Laws of Robotics, through profanity delay or the dump keys to destroy or recycle by generating inconsistency the Three Laws of Robotics theory.

title: I hate people but I love you
description_cn: 大画幅单频录像《我憎恨人但我爱你》以电脑桌面为画面背景，短片里两位赛博格（cyborg）——一位典型科幻影视造型的仿真机器人带有亚洲女子面貌，一个由无数重叠窗口构成的生物电脑不断变化着莫比乌斯带——进行着机械、呆板、反复的对话：“……我可以当你的朋友吗？你看我像真的吗？我希望是的……” “我憎恨人但我爱你……” 这套关于科技、社交和孤独的经典的科幻范式，不仅在今天社交媒体的生活中得以应证，也在用户和操作之间重新界定人际情感的疆域。
description_en: I Hate People but I Love You, is a large format single channel video installation. Set in Mac OS, the video features two cyborgs, one of which is an anticipated Asian female android, the other in disguise of a floating Möbius strip composed of pop-up windows. Both immerse themselves in a reiterated deadpan conversation: “…May I be your friend? Do I look real to you? I hope so…” “I hate people but I love you.” The classic sci-fi paradigm of dystopian sentiments regarding social interaction and loneliness is not only proven in today's social media life, but also redefines the boundaries of interpersonal emotion between users and operations.

title: I was dead on the Internet
description_cn: 我死于互联网，我曾经以为我在这里成长。这两年困在柏林生长在庞大的顶楼阳台上，边沁式的圆形监狱，观察着所有邻居的日常，同时在互联网上求生的自己还是死去了，在冬日强风下竹叶的飘动沙沙声抹去手指摩擦屏幕留下油腻的指纹，身体沉在沙发里，黑色的皮面散发着头发的气味，灰尘包裹着真菌落在臂膀上，弥留中变成一棵红枫，冬季的红枫枯死枝蔓上蘑菇的痕迹随风飘散降落在另一具身体旁被蚂蚁搬走。失败的，沮丧的，不值一提的瞬间与念头死于互联网。
description_en: I was dead on the Internet, where I once thought I was raised. The past two years of trapping in Berlin, inhabiting on the huge penthouse balcony—the Benthamian panopticon—observing the daily routine of all the neighbours while surviving on the Internet, I still died. Under the strong winter wind, the fluttering rustle of bamboo leaves erased the greasy fingerprints left by the fingers rubbing the screen; body sunken into the sofa, with its black leather surface that smelled of hair, dust wrapped in fungus falling on the arms, on the deathbed, transforming into a red maple. The branches of the red maple dried out during the winter. Remnants left by the mushrooms were drifted away with the wind, landing next to another body and being carried away by ants. Failure, frustration, worthless moments and thoughts die on the Internet.

title: I was dead on the Internet
description_en: I was dead on the Internet, where I once thought I was raised. The past two years of trapping in Berlin, inhabiting on the huge penthouse balcony—the Benthamian panopticon—observing the daily routine of all the neighbours while surviving on the Internet, I still died. Under the strong winter wind, the fluttering rustle of bamboo leaves erased the greasy fingerprints left by the fingers rubbing the screen; body sunken into the sofa, with its black leather surface that smelled of hair, dust wrapped in fungus falling on the arms, on the deathbed, transforming into a red maple. The branches of the red maple dried out during the winter. Remnants left by the mushrooms were drifted away with the wind, landing next to another body and being carried away by ants. Failure, frustration, worthless moments and thoughts die on the Internet. The exhibition is a direct outcome of the deletion of aaajiao's Weibo account in 2020, exploring human and non-human vulnerability, nature and life after death in the age of surveillance.

title: Jelly.data
description_en: Interactive Installation for Sustainable Imagination Exhibition

title: Karesansui
description_cn: 枯山水（karesansui）或“干景”园，通常称为禅园，通过精心构造的石头、水景、苔藓、修剪的树木和灌木，运用细沙或石子铺成的波纹，创造出一种迷你化的风景。创造一种安静的氛围，其中蕴含着一种“趋势”，即一下刻的运动，此“势”就是力量：生命的力量，同时也是运动中静止的瞬间，以静制动。
description_en: Karesansui or "dry landscape" is made possible with the collaboration of Xu Cong (media artist). It creates a miniature stylised landscape through carefully composed arrangements of rocks, water features, moss, pruned trees and bushes, and uses gravel or sand that is raked to represent ripples in water. This art form creates a peaceful and quiet moment, embodying a 'trend' that reflects movement; this 'potential' is a power: a power of growth, but also in the stillness of instant motion, inaction. The term originally refers to a microcosmic landscape arranged with fine gravel and stones, without any water features, where 'water' is represented by sand and 'mountains' by rocks, creating tranquility that contains a trend of movement, a kind of force: a power of growth and the stillness of motion.

title: Karesansui
description_cn: 枯山水 (karesansui) for KeeClub 历峰双墅：位于淮海中路796号，为两栋新古典主义双子别墅，分别建于1921年及1927年。曾是上海民航局、电影局办公楼旧址，浓缩了近一个世纪上海东西方文化交融的历史。
description_en: Karesansui or "dry landscape" is made possible with the collaboration of Xu Cong (media artist). This installation is located at KeeClub, which consists of two neoclassical twin villas built in 1921 and 1927, highlighting nearly a century of cultural fusion in Shanghai.

title: Life Mapping
description_en: Algorithm generated Turritopsis nutricula

title: Limited Landscape, Unlimited
description_cn: 一件探讨无限风景主题的视频装置，通过LCD显示器与压克力组件展示。该作品旨在反映人类对自然与科技复杂性的感知，由刘晓光合作完成。编码开发自playfuljs。
description_en: A video installation exploring the theme of limitless landscapes, presented on an LCD screen with acrylic fittings. The work is designed to reflect the complexities of human perception of nature and technology, made possible through collaboration with Liu Xiaoguang. Code based on playfuljs.

title: Light is shadow / 光既影
materials: This work involves the concept of blue in the screen dimension, discussing the intersection of light and shadow.
description_cn: 我们选择的蓝色实际上是各种屏幕和投影仪的默认颜色。所有这类电子设备开机时都会提供蓝色的光。我们把屏幕看作一种新的维度，而蓝色则成为这种新空间的标识符。它就像通往新世界的门。我的作品的基本理念是在这个“蓝色”维度中。在这个区域，我们用一种新方式来解释原有的物体，光与影的结合是一种新的概念。
description_en: The blue we choose actually is the default color for all kinds of screens and projectors. All this kind of electronic device will provide a blue color when it starts. If we look at the screen as a new dimension, the blue color will be the identified symbol for this new space. It acts like a door to the new world. The basic idea of my work is within this 'blue' dimension. In this area, we explain the original object in a new way, where light and shadow are combined.

description_cn: 这次合作探讨了服装与艺术的交汇点，创造了一款基于军事M65设计风格的时尚工作服夹克，融入复杂的印刷技艺以提高其艺术价值。
description_en: This collaboration explores the intersection of clothing and art, creating a stylish workwear jacket based on the Military M65 design, incorporating intricate printing techniques to enhance its artistic value.

title: Membranization

description_cn: 膜化是一件装置艺术作品，利用PVC板和太阳能薄膜创造一个沉浸式环境，邀请观众与透明度和分层的概念互动。
description_en: Membranization is an installation art piece that utilizes PVC sheets and solar films to create an immersive environment, inviting viewers to interact with the concepts of transparency and layering.

title: Mindlight.data
description_en: Video Installation for greenpix. Concept by aaajiao, with support by arthub and curated by Defne Ayas.

title: Minority Algorithm
description_en: Minority Algorithm, a video work discussing the void of the internet, includes stories of decentralized Counterhistory compositions in social struggles formed by the smartphone peeping perspective based on short video apps, the astonishing fact that drone killing videos in war are rapidly spread and gamified through social media with the blessing of algorithms, and the fictional narratives formed by AI computing power shaping artificial landscapes and natural disasters, as well as the devastation brought to individual laborers by the fundamental step of AI training that cannot be bypassed—manual annotation, and the alienation of people's perception of the physical world after being shaped by computing power. While I see the omnipresent computing power and algorithms, I also notice that the human heart is everywhere, and the flow of empathy and curiosity tears through the neat, proud, and expensive authority, revealing void and smelling the streams.

title: NTFs_aaajiao
description_cn: 一个加密的zip，当作品通过NFTs交易之后，拥有作品的人会获得Zip文件以及解压所需的密码。Zip使用的密码是在社工库中找到的aaajiao常用密码，即被破解公开的密码。通过NFTs交易，收藏者获得zip的解压密码。
description_en: NTFs_aaajiao is an encrypted .ZIP file folder that contains four images. Freely available to download but locked and encrypted, only the collector who acquired the work through an NFT transaction will receive the password to unlock the folder’s contents. This password is aaajiao’s common password found in the Social Engineering data, i.e., the password that has been cracked publicly. The file icons themselves have been edited, with a superimposed self-portrait of the artist. With contents not visible to the public, the image of the ZIP folder in its finder window container is the only visual representation available.

title: Nobody
materials: 3D transparent resin printing, printed car film, glasurit / 3D透明树脂打印，打印汽车膜，鹦鹉漆
description_cn: 在一个AI 利用图片生成3D的平台上，有个公开案例：以一名亚洲男性为对象，艺术家将其3D模型用透明树脂打印，并用车模贴花工艺把头部贴图覆回实物。源图是否也是AI生成不得而知。这个随机的“亚洲男性”像标本般被测试后遗留在算力驱动的网站上——无名，却承载身份政治，如同一张孤独的身份证。
description_en: On an image-to-3D AI platform, a public case features an 'Asian male' whose model is printed in transparent resin, with the head texture reapplied by an automotive decal technique. Whether the source image was itself AI-generated is unknown. This random 'Asian male'—a specimen of sorts—remains on a compute-heavy site after testing: nameless yet burdened with identity politics, like a solitary ID card.

title: Noise
description_cn: 白噪音纵贯电视时代和屏幕时代, 也是声音到视觉的连贯, 古老却依旧着蕴藏力量。
description_en: White noise runs through the television and screen eras, but is also the sound to the visual continuity of the ancient and still is a hidden strength.

title: One ritual
description_cn: 以郭老师与药水哥的标志性片段为骨架，将“耶斯莫拉”“迷hotel”“您配吗”等梗语以动态字体化作屏幕的呼吸与鼓点，让语言在复读中自我增幅，召唤出一场持续生成的“直播仪式”。看与被看在弹幕与切片之间迭代，围观者在狂欢中获得短暂连结，却在笑声散场的静默里照见“乐子人”式的疏离与空心，孤独像回声一样从喧嚣深处返场。抽象文化可被概括为一种反逻辑、反叙事、反权威的网络亚文化，通过脏话、方言、错位语义与黑话化再生产，完成对主流话语的“消解”与“滑移”。其渊源可追溯至2015年前后的直播潮与“6324”等主播社群生态，并在围观、嘲讽、二创的循环中被持续放大。抽象内容以“反常识—反精致—反逻辑”的即时愉悦为吸力，满足“娱乐至上”的观看逻辑，观众通过复读与二创获得短暂的共同体错觉。然而，围观者多以“乐子人”心态消费“他者的出丑”，以恶搞与冷嘲构筑脆弱的连接，情感承诺极低，导致共时热闹与纵深孤独并存。抽象文化提供了可快速合唱的语言模板，却难以生成稳定的社群纽带，映照出社会原子化语境中“人—人关系”的空洞化。
description_en: Built on iconic clips by Guo Laoshi and Yaoshui-ge, catchphrases like “yesmola,” “mi hotel,” and “Are you worthy?” become kinetic typography—breath and beat for the screen. Through repetition, language amplifies itself, conjuring a “livestream ritual” that keeps generating. Seeing and being seen iterate between barrages and clips; the crowd touches a fleeting bond in the carnival, only to meet, in the hush after laughter, the lezi-ren’s (fun-seeker’s) alienation and hollow core—loneliness returning like an echo from noise. “Abstract culture” names an online subculture that is anti-logic, anti-narrative, anti-authority, dissolving mainstream speech through profanity, dialect, semantic slippage, and insider jargon. Emerging from the livestream wave circa 2015 and streamer scenes like “6324,” it grows through watching, mockery, and remixes. Its pull is an instant gratification of 'anti-common sense—anti-refinement—anti-logic,' feeding a watchword of entertainment-first; viewers gain a brief illusion of commonality by repetition and remix. Yet most look on as lezi-ren, consuming others’ embarrassment with spoof and cold sneer. The ties are thin, the affect low: synchronous bustle alongside deep solitude. Abstract culture offers a chorus-ready template, but struggles to form durable bonds, reflecting how “person-to-person” relations hollow out in an atomized society.

title: org.a
description_cn: aaajiao（徐文恺）是一位媒体艺术家和媒体与互联网活动家，他通过将1999年至2016年间中国主流新闻门户网站的首页线框结构视觉化，创建了他的新作。这件作品表现为一个数字横幅的景观，赋予了作品抽象描述的物理形式。最终，这件作品表达了对当今“数字世界”中信息消费的反对，这是一种“不产生任何有意义的”廉价而无用的消费。aaajiao将数据结构转化为变化多样的比较数字形式或“横幅”，以探讨在信息数据与日常生活愈加紧密相连的时代，人们通过消费和消化信息是否发生变化。这件作品的标题像一个组织或行动的代号，听起来像一个代码命令，隐藏着双重意图。本项目首次呈现在湖南路的REFORMERart城市公共艺术空间。
description_en: aaajiao (Xu Wenkai) is a media artist and a media and internet activist. He created his new work by visualizing Chinese mainstream news portals wireframe from 1999 to 2016. This work is expressed as a digital landscape of banners that give physical form to the work's abstract description. Ultimately, this work expresses objection to the consumption of information occurring in today’s ‘digital world’, a form of ‘cheap and useless’ consumption that does not create anything meaningful. aaajiao makes data structure into changing comparative digital forms or ‘banners’ to investigate whether people change through consuming and digesting information in this age where information data and daily life are binding ever more closely. The title of this work, like a code name of an organization or operation, sounds like a code command, concealing its double intent. This project was first presented at REFORMERart city public art space on Hunan Road.
