title: Pinky Swear
materials: Various installations and moving image works
description_cn: Tabula Rasa 画廊很高兴地呈现 aaajiao 的个展“小拇指发誓”，将于 2025 年 10 月 13 日开幕。此次展览展示了新安装和动态影像作品，探讨孤独、民族主义和数字文化的回音室等主题。它集中在简体中文互联网中的“网络民族主义”概念，并调查算法治理驱动的情感和政治生态。
description_en: Tabula Rasa Gallery is pleased to present “Pinky Swear,” a solo exhibition by aaajiao, opening 13 October 2025. This exhibition features new installations and moving image works that examine themes of loneliness, nationalism, and the echo chambers of digital culture. It centers on the concept of “cyber-nationalism” across the Simplified Chinese internet and investigates the emotional and political ecology driven by algorithmic governance.

title: Progress Bar
materials: Single channel video, color, sound; screen / 单频彩色有声录像、屏幕
description_cn: 作品是与张弢和声音艺术家谭硕欣共同完成。
description_en: A collaboration with Mog and sound artist Tan Shuoxin.

title: Prompt / 视频
description_cn: 《咒文》由阿角创作，展示了生成AI过程与社会结构的交集，深刻反映了技术在塑造身份和认知中的角色。
description_en: Prompt from aaajiao on Vimeo. The work encapsulates the intersection between generative AI processes and societal constructs, presenting a deep reflection on technology's role in shaping identity and perception.

title: Prophecy, nullification algorithm, shaman, conspiracy
title_cn: 预言，失效算法，萨满，阴谋
description_en: A video installation exploring themes of prophecy and conspiracy through a nullification algorithm.

title: Pure
description_cn: RGB 三原色构建了这个世界一切动态可视化信息,分离的展示RGB的变化应该是神圣纯粹的。
description_en: RGB colour build this world with all dynamic visual information, separating RGB display changes should be purely sacred.

title: RealPacman
description_en: An interactive installation for the e-Arts Festival in Shanghai, featuring contributions from aaajiao and others.

title: Remnants of an Electronic Past
description_cn: "电子遗留物"是上海艺术家aaajiao (徐文恺)在OCAT西安馆举办的个展，展示了一系列为此次展览特别委托的新作品。展览从2016年6月18日持续至9月11日，也是aaajiao在多个美术馆个展和群展中的第一场，探讨了随着科技发展过时软件的命运。项目反映了传统知识与现代技术媒体之间的关系，涉及消费与对不断变化的科技的怀旧情感。
description_en: "Remnants of an Electronic Past", a museum solo exhibition of Shanghai-based artist aaajiao (Xu Wenkai) at OCAT Xi’an, featuring a body of new works commissioned for the show. Opening June 18 and running through September 11th, 2016, this exhibition marks the first in a series of institutional solo exhibitions and museum group shows for aaajiao, exploring the fate of outdated software amid advancing technology. The project reflects on the relationship between traditional knowledge and contemporary technological media, touching on themes of consumption and nostalgia towards the nature of evolving technologies.

title: Remnants of an Electronic Past
description_en: To celebrate Manchester's position as European City of Science 2016, Centre for Chinese Contemporary Art (CFCCA) presents the first UK solo exhibition by Shanghai based new-media artist, aaajiao. The exhibition explores the history of Windows Operating Systems and our relationship with digital technologies through immersive installations.

title: Repeatedly
description_cn: 用非常小的一张gif构造一块深度无限的空间。.gif是我们常见的一种格式,她的特点是通过反复释放信息,但也是这样的反复,让她变的如此狡猾,极富性格。
description_en: GIF is a common format which is characterised by the repetition of information. With one small GIF, an infinite depth of space is constructed, but it is also cunning and tremendously characteristic.

title: Seed 1348845846
materials: Digital printing, manual silk screening, hand drawing on linen
description_en: This artwork combines various elements capturing the essence of an internet data center alongside traditional Thangka art from Tibet. It explores the intersection of contemporary technology, historical art forms, and the complexities of communication through vibrant imagery, detailed wireframes, and abstract representations of nature and architecture.

title: Seed: 3339138223
materials: Digital printing, manual silk screening, hand drawing on linen
description_en: A ghost rover of a secondary girl in Cyberspace, vintage camera, dreamy, fantasy concept art inspired by artists like Tony DiTerlizzi and Alphonse Mucha, dimensions 200cm x 200cm.

title: Seed
materials: Digital printing, manual silk screening, hand drawing on linen / 数字印刷，手工丝网印刷，亚麻手绘
description_en: A ghost rover of a secondary girl in Cyberspace, surrounded by faint columnasts and craters while posing for a photo, extreme close-up, somber, red-fabric, black-skin, white ribbons, trending on ArtStation, 8K, highly detailed, wide-angle lens, stunning volumetric lighting, dark moody atmosphere, cinematic lighting.

title: Simulate Simulator
description_cn: Ag，漫游的写作者，1985年生于上海。工作涉及短篇小说、评论、策展与电影。《模拟模拟器》是Ag受aaajiao邀请，由展览“Cave simulator / 洞穴模拟器” 为借口的短篇小说。
description_en: Ag, the roaming writer, was born in Shanghai in 1985. Work involves short stories, reviews, curation and film. _Simulate Simulator_ is a short story by Ag invited by aaajiao under the pretext of the exhibition _Cave Simulator._

title: Siu~
materials: Cellophane, UV printing / 玻璃纸，UV打印
description_cn: 延续了之前《橡皮软糖》使用的玻璃糖纸材料，UV在材料上，涂层脆弱，揉搓材料并再次铺展开，涂层会龟裂，掉落，图片的内容是LED透过玻璃映射在玻璃正面的云层的倒影中，在此刻看见了所有可被眼睛看到的光，下一刻消散破碎，念头般不值一提。
description_en: Continued the material selection in the previous gumdrop, Siu~ also uses cellphone and UV printing. The coating is fragile. After kneading the material and spreading it again, the coating will crack and fall off. The image's content reflects the clouds mapped by LED through the front of the glass. All the light that the eye can receive at this moment is dissipated and shattered in the next instant, just as worthless as one's thought.

title: Soft
description_cn: 蓝色的屏幕,犹如一道通往新纬度的大門,蓝色中运动的影子,是对日常在使用屏幕中看到现实中影子的一种抽象化处理,这样的结构让我们无法判断现实和虚拟的界限,最终放弃分辨融入其中。
description_en: With a blue screen acting as if it is a door leading to a new latitude, the blue moving shadow becomes an abstracted processing of a real screen. This structure blurs the boundaries between the 'real' and 'virtual', confusing the ability to distinguish between realities. This allows for complete immersion.

title: Mixer Installation for Virtual City
materials: concept: aaajiao, B6; sound: B6; hardwave: aaajiao, majian
description_en: A sound installation featured in the New Power – China Contemporary Art Biennale 2008, created by aaajiao.

title: Space
materials: 10' LED screen (custom can play video directly) x1 / 10 寸 LED 屏幕 -7'26''
description_cn: 当网站死去。作品是与圈圈共同完成。
description_en: When a website to die. This piece was done in collaboration with Quanquan.

title: Squab
materials: Squab model, camera, metal acrylic structure / 乳鸽模型，摄像头，金属亚克力结构
description_cn: 许多公共户外摄像头为防止鸽子停歇和排泄，会安装特制的金属防鸟刺。作品借用这一日常装置，并将一只乳鸽模型“扎”在刺上。乳鸽在华语文化中是一种常见且受欢迎的食材，常见于粤菜与港式料理，被视为高蛋白、低脂的理想选择；对移民而言，乳鸽与诸多原乡食物一样，承载维系语言与社群的纽带，唤起有关“家”的熟悉感，缓解孤独与疏离。然而，当“乳鸽”作为食物的现实，与“鸽子”在更广泛语境中象征和平与洁净的意象相遇时，关于文化身份的隔阂与偏见也随之浮现。
description_en: To keep pigeons from perching and fouling, outdoor surveillance cameras are often fitted with metal anti-bird spikes. This work appropriates that familiar hardware, “impaling” a squab model on the prongs. In Sinitic cuisines, squab is a prized staple—especially in Cantonese and Hong Kong dishes—valued as high-protein and low-fat. For migrants, like many foods of home, it binds language and community, conjuring a sense of “home” that softens loneliness and estrangement. Yet when squab-as-food meets the wider emblem of the pigeon as purity and peace, the rifts and biases around cultural identity come into view.

title: Sunbathing? Not dead.
description_cn: 一张在互联网上流传的新闻照片迷因，画面中一位女孩躺在乡村商店街的台阶上，用A4纸盖住头，纸上写着：“晒太阳呢，没死，谢谢关心。”艺术家借助AI平台的算法，将照片中的人物转化为三维模型，并通过3D打印与手工上色重现这一场景。然而，算法并不能细腻地还原人物的具体形态，模型因而呈现出一种看似随机却仍可辨识的“孤独”形状。
description_en: Based on a widely shared news photo: a girl lies on the steps of a village storefront, an A4 sheet over her face that reads, “Sunbathing, not dead, thanks for your concern.” The artist used an AI platform to convert the figure into a 3D model, then re-staged the scene via 3D printing and hand painting. The algorithm cannot recover precise physiognomy; the result is a form that feels arbitrary yet legible, a shape of “loneliness.”

title: Tennis for none
materials: -A small projection (custom can play video directly) x1 / 投影 -9'01''
description_cn: Tennis for Two (1958) 是最早的一款电子游戏,而 Tennis for none 是 一款《电子遗留物》游戏。
description_en: Tennis for Two (1958) is the earliest a video game, Tennis for none but a Remnants of an Electronic Past game.

title: Placebo
description_en: A solo exhibition featuring works that explore the theme of placebo effects through various digital print mediums.

title: Text Format II
description_en: Numerous format conversion error image, size 160cm × 68cm.

title: The Screen Generation
description_cn: chi K11艺术空间荣幸地带来本年度的压轴展览，艺术家aaajiao（徐文恺）个展《屏幕一代》。作为K11 Art Foundation大力扶持的中国前沿媒体艺术家，aaajiao的作品专注于对数据的挖掘与实用，并试图以多种形式将其呈现，以此在数据与现实的“调制解调”中完成对作品内涵的完整表达。本次展览将呈现aaajiao的6件新作，展览将于2013年12月14日开幕，展至2014年2月15日。展览中将探讨科技如何使用自身进行自我呈现，以及这对于人类感知和理解的影响。
description_en: chi K11 Art Space is pleased to present The Screen Generation, solo exhibition of artist aaajiao (Xu Wenkai) and also the finale exhibition of 2013 at the space. As one of the young generation artists sponsored by K11 Art Foundation, aaajiao is a leading new media artist in China. His work features exploration and application of data in various forms, endeavoring to present a full picture of his practice and his thought behind it through the modulation/demodulation of data and reality. Known for his ingenious and innovative experiment in integrating computer software with art, in this upcoming solo exhibition, aaajiao will be presenting six of his latest works. Different from the artist’s previous solo exhibitions which showcased logical enquiries and research on data itself, The Screen Generation will share with the audience a more personal experience. The exhibition will open to public on December 14, 2013 and run through February 15, 2014. In the meantime, a series of public education events and seminars will be held during the exhibition at both chi K11 Art Space and Minsheng Art Museum. The six pieces that make up The Screen Generation are Soft, Repeatedly, Hard, Pure, Static, and Noise, which all exist and begin as digital applications developed by the artist. The display medium used in The Screen Generation is flat screen. According to the artist, as a generation who have long been surrounded by information technology, 'we' have gradually become information nodes. The screens in this exhibition serve as containers and frames for the interactions between the audience and the digital applications, emphasizing the human-oriented nature of the artworks.

title: The Screen Generation: Prequel
description_cn: 新媒体艺术家aaajiao在北京 C－空间 的个展《屏幕一代：前传》中将呈现六件新的作品，区别于艺术家之前的两次关于对数据本身理性研究的个展，这一次的呈现将会是一次柔软的体验。作品分别为“柔软”、“反复”、“坚硬”、“纯粹”、“静止”和“闹”，它们都存在和源自艺术家开发的电子应用程序。
description_en: In new media artist aaajiao’s upcoming solo exhibition at C-Space, The Screen Generation: Prequel, the artist will be presenting six of his newest works. While differing from the artist’s previous solo exhibitions which showcased logical enquiries and research on data itself, this presentation will be a more personal experience for the audience. The six pieces that make up The Screen Generation are Soft, Repeatedly, Hard, Pure, Static, and Noise, the artworks all exist and begin as digital applications developed by the artist.

title: The Screen Generation
description_cn: 《屏幕一代》@9平米美术馆是《屏幕一代》系列作品在美学探索上的一次小结。与前两次的展览比较而言，《屏幕一代@9平米美术馆》将屏幕与人的相互关系阐述得更加情绪明确。在《屏幕一代》系列作品中，艺术家最初为观众提出了两个命题，一是应用程序生成数据，转换成屏幕上的图像和声音，通过不断的自我展示，带给人类感官与情感的体验。另外一个命题讨论早已被信息化的“我们”逐渐变成信息的节点，使用屏幕的同时也成为屏幕本身，从而与屏幕彼此构成生态系统的现状。本次作品避开了新媒体艺术中容易让人产生理解偏差的“拟人”和“拟物”的观点，将屏幕与人，即科技与人类相互关系的大命题巧妙地落在一件细微之物——首饰上。一贯冷静理性的视觉形象，结晶糖块的味觉体验，吮咬糖块和反复拨弄磁球的心理暗示，心理暗示造成的强迫性的精神反应与行为结果，通过首饰与人肌肤相亲这一个简单的联结，《屏幕一代@9平米美术馆》将屏幕与人的平等、共生和共同发展的社会关系举重若轻地铺展开来。
description_en: The Screen Generation @ 9m²-Museum can be seen as a summary of the aesthetic exploration made by the Screen Generation Series. Compared with the previous two presentations, The Screen Generation @ 9m²-Museum addresses the interactive relation between man and screen in a more direct and clearer way. In the Screen Generation Series, the artist raises two propositions. The first is to transform application-generated data into images and sounds on screen and to give people sensual and emotional experience through constant presentation. The other is that as a generation having long been surrounded by information technology, 'we' have gradually become information nodes. In other words, as digital screen users, we have been developed into a screen generation where we become the screen itself. Aaajiao’s work aptly evades concepts such as 'personification' and 'objectification' that would easily cause confusion and misunderstanding of new media art. In this piece, a complex issue as the interplay between man and screen, or say between man and technology, is skillfully encapsulated in something as subtle as a piece of jewelry. The wearing of these jewelry pieces epitomizes a connection between man and screen. By combining visual images (which are cool and rational as always), sense of taste (of the sugar crystals), psychological hint (given by the action of licking and fondling), and compulsion (on both physical and mental levels), Screen Generation @ 9m² -Museum manages to cast light on equality, co-existence and co-development of the relation between screen and man in a humorous way.

title: Time Refactoring
description_cn: 表现主义思潮经历了一整个世纪的变迁，与上海美术馆一个世纪以来的变迁一样，经由时间的洗练，历久弥新。影像抓住‘时间’这一线索，试图用一种重新构建的手法，去展现这一变化，通过对上海美术馆外立面的立体投影，采取描边、勾线、扭曲变形、表面重建、波形震荡、轴向层级展开等蒙太奇手法，将展览作品的变迁，用影像的方式重新再现。碎片化的叙述结构和对时间轴非线性整理，使时间的概念得以重构。
description_en: Projection mapping for Shanghai Art Museum revealing the evolution of expressionism across a century. The work showcases the transformation through various montage techniques, employing outline and distortion effects on the museum's exterior to depict changes in the exhibited artwork, reconstructing the concept of time with a fragmented narrative structure.

title: Trfinite I
description_cn: 徐文恺的机器风景，可以被看作媒体艺术领域在自然融合方面的贡献，其中包含来自分形理论的因素，算法构建的机械装置，如同海浪或生物。艺术家为虚拟模拟和算法进行了物理性延伸，作品的镜面和实际发生的运动所构成的图像，将与观众互动，形成一个不断变化和蔓延的空间。艺术家徐文恺的作品简单直接作用于艺术与科技，并延续他之前作品一贯的科技悖论之线索。——李振华
description_en: The Robotic Landscape of aaajiao serves as media art’s contribution to our integration with nature. The work is a mechanical installation that operates on fractal algorithms. The organic or wave-like structure of the work can be seen as the physical extension of a virtual simulation and algorithms. The image created by the reflective surface of the robot as it assumes motion generates points of interaction with the audience, forming an ever changing and expanding space. aaajiao’s work acts directly on art and technology, and has persistently engaged various paradoxes within the development of science. －Li Zhenhua

title: Trfinite II
description_cn: 徐文恺的机器风景，可以被看作媒体艺术领域在自然融合方面的贡献，其中包含来自分形理论的因素，算法构建的机械装置，如同海浪或生物。艺术家为虚拟模拟和算法进行了物理性延伸，作品的镜面和实际发生的运动所构成的图像，将与观众互动，形成一个不断变化和蔓延的空间。艺术家徐文恺的作品简单直接作用于艺术与科技，并延续他之前作品一贯的科技悖论之线索。——李振华
description_en: The Robotic Landscape of aaajiao serves as media art’s contribution to our integration with nature. The work is a mechanical installation that operates on fractal algorithms. The organic or wave-like structure of the work can be seen as the physical extension of a virtual simulation and algorithms. The image created by the reflective surface of the robot as it assumes motion generates points of interaction with the audience, forming an ever changing and expanding space. aaajiao’s work acts directly on art and technology, and has persistently engaged various paradoxes within the development of science. －Li Zhenhua

title: Turritopsis nutricula
materials: algorithm generated Turritopsis nutricula, computer graphics : aaajiao, liu xiaoguang
description_en: First discovered in the Mediterranean in 1883, the Turritopsis Nutricula is a hydrozoan, whose Medusa (jellyfish) is effectively immortal. When threatened, the Medusa’s cells can age backwards from sexual maturity to those halcyon days of jellyfish childhood. From there, they age again, then regress again, ad infinitum. This happens through a process called transdifferentiation, in which one type of cell switches to another type. For this piece, aaajiao created an algorithmically generated swarm of these creatures. As the pixelated bloom floats by, one thinks about how the digital age confounds the linear march of time. The two poles of Turritopis‘s existence–youth and sexual maturity–find parallel in our division between the virtual world and the physical.

title: URL is LOVE - 2020 URL is LOVE - A Digital Retrospective
title_cn: URL是爱 - 2020 URL是爱 - 数字回顾展
description_cn: Tabula Rasa画廊荣幸地宣布将于2020年8月1日起呈现艺术家aaajiao的数字作品回顾展“2020 URL是爱 - 数字回顾展”。这是Tabula Rasa画廊与aaajiao合作的首次在线个展，展出aaajiao从2008年到2020年利用互联网作为创作媒介的最具代表性的作品，探讨数字时代身份和自由的主题。
description_en: Tabula Rasa Gallery is pleased to present artist aaajiao’s online retrospective '2020 URL is LOVE - A Digital Retrospective' from August 1st, 2020. This exhibition marks the first solo exhibition collaboration between Tabula Rasa Gallery and aaajiao, showcasing works that employed Internet as medium from 2008 to 2020. It represents a history of technology use by a Chinese millennial artist/netizen, emphasizing the nature of the Internet and the impact of virtual artworks. Inspired by Tim Berners-Lee's vision for the World Wide Web, it explores themes of identity and freedom in the digital age.

title: Untitled
description_cn: 这是一件以LCD屏幕和压克力组件为特征的视频装置，尺寸为16 x 24 x 3.4cm。视频持续4分钟。这件作品是与许聪共同完成的。
description_en: A video installation featuring an LCD screen and acrylic fittings, measuring 16 x 24 x 3.4cm. The duration of the video is 4 minutes. This work was made possible in collaboration with Xu Cong.

title: Two rituals
description_cn: 这件作品由三部分素材拼合而成：使用孙三通的神调《哭烟魂》、Ag祖传自奶奶的地藏仪轨行为视频- Ksitigarbha，以及宫泽发布于朋友圈的生活片段，最终被重新剪辑成单一的视频。其叙事线索来自宫泽讲述的东北（哈尔滨）同辈从俱乐部文化到直播带货再到转入“出马仙”式的“心理咨询/安抚”角色的转变，并由Ag以地藏信仰与“废墟—中阴（bardo）”的城市感受为精神框架将三者串联。作品的叙事线索来自宫泽对东北（哈尔滨）同辈的一段代际轨迹的讲述：从少年混迹俱乐部、进入club工作，转向直播带货，再在经济转折后进入“出马仙”体系，以“看事/安抚”的方式承担某种“心理咨询”角色。这一路径与简中互联网及社会舆论的阶段性变迁同频，呈现“民间灵性—平台经济—代际生计”的流变，并在语义上将“心理医生式”的社会角色与《哭烟魂》的劝解功能对位。Ag的行动框架来自江南关于地藏的民间供养仪轨“插棒香（插地香）”——既是家族传承，也是其介入城市现场的方法论。2016年，Ag曾在普陀“七家村”旧址公开完成相关仪式。Ag对上海的整体感知是“中阴（bardo）/幻觉之城”：将中心的褶皱、地下与边缘与高耸光鲜视为同一连续体，并以“废墟—中阴—愿力”的转换逻辑来塑造角色与场景。定海桥动迁后的“暂时性废墟”成为拍摄起点，并与地藏诞辰日完成的插香仪轨相互嵌合，指向一种“在混凝土中寻找泥土缝隙”的身体化观看方式。后疫情时期的无人驾驶地铁与“幽灵列车”意象呼应“无头无尾的电影”，与“在黑暗中看得更清”的清眼动作构成隐喻链条，支撑“中阴在废墟中”的影像语感。最终成片以《哭烟魂》铺陈声场，Ag的废墟身体表演执掌视觉叙事，朋友圈的日常影像作为现实的刺点插入。此种并置让民间信仰、当代城市经验与平台化生活同时发生，构筑出“愿力穿行中阴”的观看机制与叙事框架。
description_en: Three strands are braided into a single cut: Sun Santo’s sacred tune Crying Smoke-Soul; Ag’s ritual performance of Ksitigarbha inherited from his grandmother; and everyday clips Gongze posted to his friend circle. The narrative takes its cue from Gongze’s account of peers in Harbin: drifting through club culture, turning to livestream commerce, then—amid economic shifts—entering the “chuma xian” spirit-medium system to “see/soothe,” a role akin to informal counseling. Ag threads these with a framework of Ksitigarbha devotion and an urban sensorium of “ruin—bardo.” The trajectory mirrors phases of the Simplified-Chinese internet and public discourse, charting the currents of “folk spirituality—platform economy—generational livelihood,” and placing the consolatory function of Crying Smoke-Soul in counterpoint to a social role likened to a “psychiatrist.” Ag’s method draws on a Jiangnan rite for Ksitigarbha—“inserting stick incense” into the earth—both a family lineage and a way to intervene on site. In 2016, Ag enacted it at the former “Qijia Village” in Putuo. Shanghai, in Ag’s grasp, is a “bardo/illusory city”: center and fold, underground and edge, gleam and height as a single continuum, where roles and scenes turn on the axis “ruin—bardo—vow-power.” The “temporary ruins” left by the Dinghai Bridge relocation anchor the shoot and interlock with an incense rite on Ksitigarbha’s birthday, proposing a bodily way of seeing that “finds soil’s seams in concrete.” In the post-pandemic city, driverless metros and the “ghost train” rhyme with a “headless, tailless film,” linking to a clear-eyed practice of “seeing better in the dark”—a chain of metaphors that gives the image its “bardo-in-ruins” cadence. The finished edit lays its sound bed with Crying Smoke-Soul; Ag’s ruin-body performance steers the image; and friend-circle clips puncture the surface as reality’s burrs. Folk belief, urban experience, and platformed life are made concurrent, elaborating a viewing mode and narrative in which “vow-power moves through the bardo.”

title: Untitled
description_cn: 作品是与许聪完成。
description_en: made possible with the collaboration of Xu Cong.

title: Untitled
materials: LCD screen, acrylic fittings / LCD显示器，压克力组件
description_cn: 作品是与张弢完成。
description_en: A video installation piece made possible with the collaboration of Mog.

title: Untitled
materials: LCD screen, acrylic fittings ／ LCD显示器，压克力组件
description_cn: 一件视频装置，包含LCD显示器和压克力组件，尺寸为16 x 24 x 3.4 cm，时长4分钟。作品是与张弢完成。
description_en: A video installation featuring LCD screen and acrylic fittings, measuring 16 x 24 x 3.4 cm, with a duration of 4 minutes. Made possible with the collaboration of Mog.

title: Unzip
description_en: aaajiao’s “Unzip” is a 88 zip sub-package file. Each zip is an NFT. If the collector wishes to unzip the sub-package, they must collect all of the 88 zip sub-packages. Is it possible that an NFT, which creates value out of trading, may also inspire curiosity and solidarity through trading?

title: User, Love, High-frequency Trading
materials: Video Installation, pixelated GIF animation, programmed hourglass, kinetic installation
description_cn: 《用户、爱、高频交易》是新媒体艺术家aaajiao的第二次个展，探讨了数字世界中身份和角色的问题，通过多种装置和视频作品的呈现。展览考察了用户与技术之间的关系，聚焦于社交互动、情感表达和算法与网络的影响。主要作品包括一部探讨现实与联系概念的赛博格视频装置，以及通过水滴视觉化高频交易数据的沙漏。
description_en: "User, Love, High-frequency Trading" is the second solo exhibition by new media artist aaajiao, exploring identities and roles in the digital landscape through multiple installations and video works. The show investigates the relationship between users and technology, focusing on the mechanisms of social interaction, emotional expression, and the effects of algorithms and networking. Key works include a video installation that features cyborgs exploring concepts of reality and connection, and an hourglass that visually interprets high-frequency trading's data through water drips.

title: WELT
materials: Decentralized application, Blockchain structure, interactive editing screen
description_cn: WELT 是一个链接，一个 Dapp，一个真相，探索赛博形象的边界。用户可以编辑像素，结构鼓励创造，同时给予像素创造者价值。这件作品由新时线媒体艺术中心（上海）、那比艺术中心（首尔）、新美术馆 Rhizome（纽约）联合委约创作。
description_en: WELT is a link, a Dapp, and a truth exploring the boundaries of cyber-identity. Users can edit pixels, and the structure encourages creativity while attributing value to pixel creators. This work was co-commissioned by Chronus Art Center (Shanghai), Art Center Nabi (Seoul), and Rhizome of the New Museum (New York).

title: WYSIWYG
materials: Pcb, smt placement, metal and PVC accessories / 电路板、贴片机、金属和PVC结构
description_cn: 作品与马健和刘晓光共同完成。
description_en: A collaboration with Ma juan and Liu Xiaoguang.

title: Water Measure - Petroleum
materials: Antipodes glass bottles, BLK water, peristaltic pump structure, metal and acrylic accessories / 绮怡玻璃瓶、BLK水、蠕动泵结构、金属和亚克力配件
description_cn: 装置《水测·石油》将高频交易中的冗余数据转译成了二进制代码，在水瓶中以类似沙漏滴漏的方式进行着冗长且又毫无意义的计算。This piece was done in collaboration with Ma Juan and Shen Jiujiu. / 作品是与马健和沈赳赳共同完成。
description_en: “Water Measure-Petroleum” is a programmed hourglass filled with petroleum-like pitch-black water. Every drip of water reads the binary coded redundant data filtered from high-frequency trading—a futile gesture of reading useless or meaningless information created within the shortest possible amount time by the largest possible multitude of users and operations.

title: Water measure
materials: wood, iron, peristaltic pump, glass jar
description_en: Measuring the volume of the email list of artmailart.com in reality.

title: Waving Bamboo
description_en: Waving Bamboo is a self generated structure. A dynamic environment is created by strategically arranging the bamboos and connecting them according to specific algorithms. The various spaces offer people different experiences within a continuous environment. Bamboo is chosen to construct the structure due to its special material characteristics as well as its natural features.

title: Windows Gravestone
materials: metal structure with UV print / 金属结构和 UV 打印
description_cn: 作品是与许聪和沈赳赳共同完成。给视窗系统构建墓碑。
description_en: This piece was done in collaboration with Xu Cong and Shen jiujiu. Built for OS Windows Graveston.

title: Xindanwei: A new way of working
title_cn: 新单位:一种新的工作方式
description_cn: 新单位是中国最早的协作式工作空间，也是中国最先锋的草根创意社群之一。我们致力于建立协作 Workspace 与创意社区，支持乐于分享与合作的创业者和创新者。
description_en: Xindanwei is the first and largest multidisciplinary coworking community in China, listed among FastCompany’s "The World’s Top 10 Most Innovative Companies in China." It provides community workspaces that foster creative collaboration and innovation.

title: a'a'a'jiao: an ID
description_cn: 昊美术馆（上海）荣幸地宣布，将于2019年4月27日至2019年7月14日举办aaajiao/徐文恺个展 “a'a'a'jiao：一个ID”。本次展览属于昊美术馆推出的中国青年艺术家HOW NOW系列展览。1989年，万维网在英国科学家蒂姆·伯纳斯·李（Tim Berners-Lee）手中诞生。aaajiao（徐文恺）正是在数字技术与网络连接中成长的一代。三十年之后的今天，人们仍然无法用一个词或者一句话来描述互联网带来的改变。在aaajiao看来，技术带来了更多的可能性，满足了人们更多的欲望，同时也带来新的困局和危机：人们越来越以数字和在线的形式存在，被更紧密和广泛地联系在一起，“独立”、“自由”越来越成为无可理喻的抽象概念。数量难以想象的数据被争夺和控制，技术的空前强大和渗透使强权的宰治变得便捷，人们越来越面临爱德华·威尔逊（Edward O. Wilson）描述的“真社会生物”中个体异化的危险。如果说艺术表现着人们心灵的形状，那么这一形状正在被技术深深地改变着。针对这一问题，艺术家们如果想有所作为，只能从技术的核心和机制中展开工作，而aaajiao由于所学学科的原因正处于这一位置，他直接面对并紧紧拥抱了革新中的技术和思想，从对技术的反思中探索着人类精神的安全出口，同时赋予作品以新的思维和美学。
description_en: We are pleased to announce that HOW Art Museum (Shanghai) will be hosting a solo exhibition of aaajiao/Xu Wenkai aaajiao: an ID from April 27, 2019 until July 14, 2019. This show is part of HOW NOW exhibition series featuring young Chinese artists. In 1989, the world wide web was created at the hands of the English scientist Tim Berners-Lee. aaajiao (Xu Wenkai) is part of the generation who grow up within this interconnected network and experienced the process of technological digitalization firsthand. Yet, thirty years later people are still incapable of summing up in one sentence all the changes that the internet has brought. aaajiao holds the perspective that, with the plethora of possibilities and immense satisfaction technology has brought with it a host of new dilemmas and crises: individual existence is increasingly defined online and in the form of numbers, the tightening of the internet makes the extensiveness of connectedness more immediate, causing the notions of ‘freedom’ and 'independence’ to become abstract concepts outside the range of perception. The attainment and ascendance of an unfathomable amount of data paired with the unprecedented penetration of preeminence via technology make governance evermore convenient. People are increasingly faced with the danger of individual alienation by becoming what Edward O. Wilson described as ‘Eusocial Organisms’. If art represents the state of people's minds, then its form is in the process of being profoundly altered by technology. Faced with the given predicament, if artists hope to play any sort of role in all of this, then they must first posit their practices at the core of the technological mechanism. Due to aaajiao’s background, he welcomes and fully embraces new technology and thought brought about by this revolution; exploring the potential emergency exit for the psychological disposition of human beings through reflecting on technology while proposing a new way of thinking and aesthetics in the form of artworks.

title: Untitled
description_cn: 杨画廊将于2015年12月12日呈现新的展览“aaajiao – 不确定”。这是艺术家aaajiao在杨画廊的第一次个展，展览将持续至2016年2月29日。aaajiao在作品创作中倾向使用跨领域的语言，如建筑、电子音乐、表演、产品设计、医学等，去探索数据处理、自媒体领域以及信息过滤，以及聚焦于今天消费网络技术、生活于社交媒体中的青年一代。这代人被艺术家称之为“屏幕一代”。
description_en: A new exhibition in Gallery Yang, “aaajiao – Untitled”, is set to open on December 12th, 2015. It is the first solo exhibition of artist aaajiao presented by Gallery Yang, and will last till February 29th, 2016. In his works, aaajiao tends to employ languages of multiple fields, such as architecture, electronic music, performance, product design, and medicine, to study data processing and we-media, focusing on the young generation who are consuming internet technology and living by social media. He calls them “the screen generation”. In his view, screen has become another side of man, and vice versa. Not only is instrument an extension of man, it also has its own properties of growth, even its own will. In an era of high technology, this will, through effective dissemination and promotion is easier than ever to infiltrate into the systems of self-organization and self-management of man. It seems that the modern science, after shaking off the old religions, has created a new one. Only now we have no need for passionate will to sustain some metaphysical or transcendent world. Today, visual and aural machines are developing very fast, and we are increasingly outsourcing to the feelers of science the task of feeling the world. As a result, a life of continuous attracting and dumping, surprise and oblivion, wraps up like onion peel our human experiences, which, existing either in virtual or real world, are seamless in the eyes of the artist. In contrast to the rational spirit, today’s experiences lie scattered and mixed on the playground of time like two defeated troops. And aaajiao’s works strive to face these disorderly experiences and present them to audience in a unique artistic code.

title: ai ai ai
materials: Embroidered handkerchief, digital print / 刺绣手帕，数码打印，金属结构
description_cn: 收集一张二次元形象与战争图像拼贴成看似无意义的迷因，印绣在丝质手帕上；手帕一方方系在一起，如同火灾中人们用家中布料结成的逃生绳。那些在互联网里流动的无意义迷因，又何尝不是无数人抵抗孤独、悄然求救的绳索。
description_en: A collage of an anime-styled figure and war imagery—apparently “meaningless” as a meme—is printed and embroidered on silk handkerchiefs. Knotted square to square, they recall escape ropes improvised from household cloth during a fire. The internet’s “meaningless” memes can likewise be lifelines: cords against loneliness, quiet signals for help.

title: alias: aaajiao
materials: Site-specific sculpture, algorithm-generated sponges, video, photographs, digital rendering, sculpture prototype, tattoo patterns
description_cn: LEO XU PROJECTS为大家展出活跃于国际新媒体艺术界的年轻艺术家徐文恺的首次个展。本次展览展示了aaajiao围绕互联网和数码技术对当代生活界限的探索，展品中包含了现场造型的雕塑《枯山水》，以及探索地质进化的《有限的无限风景》等作品。
description_en: LEO XU PROJECTS presents the first solo exhibition of the young Chinese media artist Xu Wenkai, known online as aaajiao. The exhibition features new works addressing issues of contemporary living with internet and digital technology. A highlight is the sculpture 'Karesansui', made of sponges that resemble rocks, creating a dystopian landscape of black mutant limbs throughout the gallery. Other featured works include 'Obj. 3' and 'Obj. 4', which are video portraits of stones, and an ongoing series 'Limited Landscape, Unlimited' exploring geologic evolution through algorithmic study.

title: anti-cybernetics
description_en: aaajiao solo exhibition: cybernetics. Caution: automatic open and close wood box, with a high volume led light.

title: Anomaly
description_cn: 《不规则》（2015）以比陨石更诡异的形态将科幻作品中对异形的美、黑暗的美的想象物化、移植进了日常空间。 This piece was done in collaboration with Xu Cong. / 作品是与许聪共同完成。
description_en: “Anomaly” (2015)—produced identically to “Karesansui” in technique and material but done in the shape of meteors—this work celebrates the classic beauty of dark imagination of biological and physical mutation that has been frequently manifested in sci-fi cinema and visual representation.

title: archive.Candy Wrappers
materials: Single channel video, color; screen, cables / 单频彩色录像、屏幕、线
description_en: Video based on / 视频根据 https://eventstructure.com/Org-a

title: bits of information
description_cn: 源于2013年的视频/程序作品Meta, 将Meta中实时生成的3D形态碎化并构成2D的信息碎片.
description_en: Based on the 2013 video/program work Meta, the real-time generative 3D shape of Meta is shredded and constitutes 2D information bits.

title: biubiu
description_cn: 一组用iPhone制造的图片，用菲林打印的方式呈现在窗户上，借助自然光呈现不同的灰度，图片成了对使用手机去观看的结果，也是我尝试去描述看见的过程，那些在记忆中会闪回又模糊的构成生活的大面积空洞，失败的细节。
description_en: This group of images was made with iPhone, presented on the window by way of film printing, with the help of natural light to show different shades of grey. These images became the result of using the iPhone to see and my attempt to describe the process of seeing. Those that would flashback and blur in memory constitute a large void in life, failure details.

title: bot / 观察者
type: Single channel video, color; Website / 单频彩色录像、网站
description_cn: 此作品与圈圈共同完成。aaajiao的作品《观察者》展示了一个深深交织于数字过去和当下的环境。在这片交汇处，本地与全球网络、社交媒体、园林结构、公园、以及最终出现的自然本身，都合并至一种数字化的超表象（hyper-representation）之中。作品从角色扮演动作游戏借鉴了大量的美学元素，反映出一个既熟悉又略显反乌托邦的世界。在这个数字空间中，物理与虚拟的界限变得模糊，引导观众思考机器学习时代下的记忆的本质。
description_en: This piece was done in collaboration with Quanquan. aaajiao displays an environment deeply intertwined with a digital past as well as its present counterpart. Reflecting on this intersection, local and global networks, social media, gardening structures, parks, and nature all become amalgamated into a digital hyper-representation. The work borrows aesthetics from existing role-playing action games, reflecting a world that is at once familiar yet slightly dystopian. In this digital space, the boundaries between the physical and the virtual blur, leading viewers to question the nature of memory in the age of machine learning.

title: bot
description_en: The work 'bot' is a single-channel video that reflects on the consumption of digital media by presenting a surreal representation of personal experiences combined with social media narratives. The accompanying installation, 'bots,' consists of nine unique inflatable objects, serving as a physical manifestation of digital concepts. Through this, aaajiao critiques the impact of game culture and social media on perception and reality.

title: bots
materials: PVC inflatables / PVC 气体模型
description_cn: 作品是与许聪共同完成。
description_en: This piece was done in collaboration with XuCong.

title: cloud.data
description_en: In the ancient legend, gestures have different mysterious powers. With these gestures and singings, people may get courage, mercy, intelligence or calm. Collecting the gesture and touch data to generate and control the cloud. With the music sound, it will give you the mental and emotional balance.

title: cursor-traces
description_cn: 作品是与 许聪 共同完成。
description_en: This piece was done in collaboration with XuCong.

title: foam wave
materials: 海绵，UV打印 ／ foam, UV print
description_cn: 这个名为「棉的浪」的装置通过多种UV打印探索了泡沫的物理属性。尺寸可变，允许在展览空间中适应。
description_en: This installation, titled 'foam wave', explores the physicality of foam through various UV prints. The dimensions are variable, allowing for adaptability in exhibition spaces.

title: ddrk.me / 低端影视
materials: Thin film, protective film on UV / 薄膜，保护膜上UV
description_cn: ddrk.me是一个叫作低端影视的网站，观察域名不难发现，“ddrk”并不是“低端影视”的拼音首字，尝试拼出来，发现是“低端人口”，在网站的关于页面，站长写道：“我们的目标是提供最便捷的，同时支持电脑和移动设备的超清画质在线观看影视剧体验。域名ddrk.me是站长自嘲，不是指访问本站的您，请勿对号入座。”我习惯性地查看了域名的whois信息并记录了下来，把这些信息打印在工业薄膜上，放进空间中，薄膜很容易产生静电，会黏在皮肤上，地上墙上，也会吸附灰尘。
description_en: ddrk.me is a website called Low-End Film and TV. It is not difficult to figure that “ddrk” is not the pinyin initials of 'Low-End Film and TV', but of 'Low-End Population' (dī duān rén kǒu). On the About page of the website, the webmaster writes that “Our goal is to provide the most convenient online viewing experience for both computers and mobile devices with ultra-clear picture quality. The domain name ddrk.me is self-deprecating and does not refer to you as a visitor to the site, so please do not take it personally." I habitually checked the domain name's whois information, recorded it, later printed it on industrial films, and included them in the space. These films easily generate static electricity, stick to the skin, the floor and walls, and absorb dust.

title: fur
materials: stuffed object, eyes toy / 毛绒物体, 眼睛玩具
description_cn: 《毛》是一件由毛绒物体组成的装置艺术，形状似各种动物，拥有生动的眼睛，深刻反映我们与自然和物体的关系。该作品是与许聪共同完成。
description_en: Fur is an installation composed of stuffed objects that resemble various animals, featuring poignant eyes, creating a reflection on our relationships with nature and objects. This work was made possible with the collaboration of Xu Cong.

title: gumdrop
materials: Cellophane, UV printing, digital printing, acrylic wood
description_cn: 一个使用玻璃纸和各种印刷技术的装置作品，展示了所用材料的特殊性质。
description_en: An installation work utilizing cellophane and various printing techniques, featuring a unique design that showcases the properties of the materials used.

title: Screen printing, chevron board, metal frame, acrylic paint / 丝网印刷, 雪弗板, 金属框, 水性漆
title_cn: Screen printing, chevron board, metal frame, acrylic paint / 丝网印刷, 雪弗板, 金属框, 水性漆
materials: Screen printing, chevron board, metal frame, acrylic paint / 丝网印刷, 雪弗板, 金属框, 水性漆
description_cn: 本系列使用雪弗板结合金属框架和水性漆的丝网印刷，展示了传统印刷技术与现代材料的结合。
description_en: A series of screen prints using chevron board in combination with metal frames and acrylic paint, showcasing a blend of traditional printmaking techniques and contemporary materials.

title: icon 2018 - 2022
materials: screen printing, chevron board, metal frame, acrylic paint
description_en: Icon 2018 - 2022 is a series of artworks that explores the concept of diaspora through various visual mediums. Each piece utilizes screen printing techniques on chevron boards framed in metal, reflecting both a contemporary aesthetic and thematic depth.

title: icon011
materials: Screen printing, chevron board, metal frame, acrylic paint / 丝网印刷，雪弗板，金属框，水性漆
description_cn: “Icon”系列是对User描摹，用手机app Pixelable 像发社交媒体动态一样，手指和智能设备的摩擦，碎片状的注意力相互敲击，听到回声，留在屏幕上。
description_en: The “icon” series portrays the User using the mobile app Pixelable to send social media updates. Among the friction of fingers and smart devices, fragmented attention taps against each other, hearing echoes that remain on the screen.

title: icongif 003-009
materials: Led screen, gif / LED屏幕, gif
description_en: A series of installations consisting of animated gifs displayed on small LED screens. Each piece is a compact 16 x 16 x 6 cm in size, utilizing visual motifs that incorporate digital aesthetics and contemporary themes of information overload and digital presence.

title: icongif 010 / icongif 010
materials: Led screen, gif / LED屏幕, gif
description_cn: 通过LED屏幕展示引人入胜的GIF动画的视觉艺术作品。
description_en: A visual art piece utilizing LED screens to display captivating GIF animations.

title: Turritopsis Nutricula / 免疫水母
description_en: Turritopsis Nutricula(infinite app) has to do with this mysterious natural phenomenon, which is beyond all cognition on human nature. The jellyfish reproduces itself asexually and its cells split continuously, from infancy to adulthood, and adulthood back to infancy. It is evidence of immortality found in nature. aaajiao transfers the jellyfish from the living into the digital form, as the examination and reflection on this phenomenon.

title: 放心 integriert / 一般 qualifiziert / 不放心 nicht integriert
title_cn: 放心 integriert / 一般 qualifiziert / 不放心 nicht integriert
description_en: This installation features a chart circulated on the internet that records the scoring of Uighur residents by a Chinese government agency. It highlights the violent implications of language as it relates to identity and government control. The piece utilizes two official fonts from China and Germany, while also sourcing documents for authenticity verification.

title: landscape 001
materials: screen printing, silicone skin, acrylic, oil-based paint
description_en: This work explores the intersection of digital and physical landscapes, utilizing various materials including screen printing and silicone to create an immersive installation. It measures 180 x 170 cm and was completed in 2022.

title: landscape 002
materials: screen printing, silicone skin, acrylic, oil-based paint
description_en: A large-scale installation featuring a combination of screen printing with silicone skin and acrylic. The artwork measures 200 x 200 cm.

title: landscape 003
materials: screen printing, silicone skin, acrylic, oil-based paint
description_en: landscape 003 is a work that explores the interface and coexistence of natural and artificial environments through the use of screen printing on silicone skin, mixed with acrylic and oil-based paints. This large-scale piece measures 222 x 109 cm.

title: landscape000
materials: Screen printing, silicone skin, acrylic, oil-based paint / 丝网印刷，硅胶皮，亚克力，油性漆
description_cn: 在公园里打坐的人，在地铁里享受春日阳光的人，在炽热的水泥地面穿着融化拖鞋散步的人，爬出城市水系的人，在这些规训的景观中，我看见自洽的失落，悲伤的无聊，臃肿的情绪，一堆景观。
description_en: Those who meditate in the park, who enjoy the spring sun in the subway, who walk in melting slippers on a blazing hot concrete floor and who climb out of the city water system, in these regimented landscapes I see the loss of self-consistency, sad boredom, bloated emotions, a bunch of landscapes.

title: landscape 005
description_cn: 该作品名为'landscape 005'，包含来自《动物之森》游戏的元素，以可变的形式呈现，允许多样的解读和形式。
description_en: This artwork, titled 'landscape 005', includes elements from the game Animal Crossing, presented in a variable format allowing for diverse interpretations and forms.

title: light_7.pmap
materials: USB flash drive, .pmap file / 优盘, pmap文件
description_cn: 无
description_en:
.pmap 是maya私有文件光文件扩展名，一个名为 light_7.pmap， 体积 211KB 的光文件储存在优盘里。这样我们便拥有了光。

*mental ray 光子贴图文件 (.pmap)。一种二进制文件，mental ray 渲染器可以使用该文件生成焦散和全局照明效果。

title: Meta
description_cn: 作品是与许聪共同完成。Meta是对信息（data）在未来如何呈现的猜想,它并聚焦在视觉的部分，而是通过呈现视觉构成的过程来研究我们所面对的可视化问题，即可视化的数据和真相是否有关，还只是另一种视觉腐败（语言腐败; 1984，“decay of the language”/“decline of the language”）的过程。
description_en: This piece was done in collaboration with Xu Cong. Meta is a conjecture on how data is presented in the future. It focuses on the visual part, but through the process of presenting visual composition to study the visualization problems we face, whether the visualized data is related to the truth or not. It's just another process for decay of the visual (1984 - George Orwell, "decay of the language" / "decline of the language").

title: Memory Vending Machines
description_cn: 记忆贩卖机（2009），是艺术家基于可预见的科技进步（纳米技术、生物科技）所提出的一项“发明”。装置的外形与基本功能类似于扭蛋机，这是一种简易自助式贩售系统，在遍布全市的便利店都可以找到。与普通扭蛋机不同，根据艺术家的设想，记忆贩卖机所售出的每一枚扭蛋看似中空，其实封装有无数个微小的纳米级机器人。随着用户吸入扭蛋内的空气，这些携带特殊信息的纳米机器人就进入脑部，附着繁殖，形成记忆区域，并且同样购买并服用“记忆扭蛋”的个体之间，可以通过记忆区域相互通讯。这实际上意味着：人们可以进入彼此的记忆，完全获取包括视觉、听觉、触觉、味觉、嗅觉……在内的感官经验，并在自己的机体上获得全部“真实”的体验（还原）。装置上的电子屏幕播放着说明性的动画，向观众介绍这项“发明”的原理和用途。
description_en: Memory Vending Machines (2009) is an “invention” proposed by the artist based on the predicted scientific advancement (nano, biotech). The appearance and basic functions of this installation are similar to that of Capsule Vending Machine. This kind of easy-to-use self-service vending machines can be found in convenience shops across the entire city. Different from general Capsule Vending Machines, this Memory Vending Machine sells capsules, which, based on the conception by the artist, seem empty inside but have actually encapsulated numerous tiny nano-robots. Inhaled by the user of the air inside the capsule, these nano-robots carrying special data will enter and colonize the human brains, and propagate themselves to form memory zones. In addition, different individuals can communicate with each other, which actually means people can enter each other’s memories and fully read sensory information including vision, hearing, feeling, tasting, olfaction, etc., and acquire the whole “real” experience (revivification) on its own organic body. Descriptive animation is played on the electronic screen of the installation, elaborating the visitors on the principles and purposes of this “invention”.

title: natural materials
materials: Memory Foam, Net Bag, PVC, Car Film, Aluminum Plate, Natural Rosin, Foam Packaging, Tinfoil Insulation Material, Soda Crackers/ 记忆海绵, 网兜, PVC, ⻋膜, 铝塑版, 天然松香,泡沫包装, 锡纸保温材料, 苏打饼干

description_en: The artwork is created using polyurethane foam for fire protection, representing the theme of nature. It measures 180 x 180 cm and was completed between 2018 and 2019.

title: nature

description_cn: 该作品是一件由防火泡沫板和金属框架制成的装置，突显自然的精妙形式。
description_en: This work features an installation made from extruded polystyrene foam board and a metal frame, highlighting nature's intricate forms.

title: digital printing
description_cn: 作品是与刘晓光共同完成，探讨了数码打印这种媒介的细微差别，强调了艺术创作的合作性质。
description_en: Made possible with the collaboration of Liu Xiaoguang. This piece explores the nuances of digital print as a medium and emphasizes the collaborative nature of art-making.

title: party

description_cn: 作品是与许聪共同完成。
description_en: This piece was done in collaboration with XuCong.

title: The Screen Generation / 屏幕一代
materials: 3D-printed resin, sugar paste, permanent magnet, red copper, cloth, abstract screens
description_cn: 2013年，媒体艺术家aaajiao(徐文恺)开展了艺术项目《屏幕一代》，在北京、上海举办了多次展览。该项目的内容从装置展延展到表演，涵盖了视觉与触觉之间的界限。此次展出的首饰与《屏幕一代》中的六件视频装置（柔软、反复、坚硬、纯粹、静止和闹）相契合，象征不同的人性特点和情感。这些作品挑战了传统首饰的装饰性，使之增进与身体的互动和对话。
description_en: In 2013, media artist aaajiao (Xu Wenkai) launched an art project titled 'The Screen Generation', exhibited numerous times in Beijing and Shanghai. This project evolved from installations to performances and between vision and touch. The jewelry here conceptualizes extensions based on 6 video installations—Soft, Repeatedly, Hard, Pure, Static, and Noise—representing various human characteristics and emotions. The pieces engage the audience, challenging the traditional notion of jewelry as merely decorative, to foster interaction and dialogue with the body.

title: protester/cursor/emoji
description_en: A website designed to explore the interplay between cursor movement and emoji representation.

title: protester/eyes
description_en: A web-based project utilizing cursor effects and providing a digital interaction exploring the representation of eyes.

title: rhizomes
description_cn: 这是一个与WLL合作创作的装置，探讨了连接和生长的主题。作品尺寸为30厘米 x 38厘米 x 100厘米，于2021年完成。
description_en: An installation created collaboratively with WLL, featuring a unique structure that explores the themes of connection and growth. The piece measures 30cm x 38cm x 100cm and was completed in 2021.

title: spectrogram
materials: Concept: aaajiao, B6; Sound: B6; Computer Graphics: aaajiao, Liu Xiaoguang
description_en: A performance that integrates various elements of sound and computer graphics, exploring deep interactions between different media.

title: The Last Media
description_cn: 社会运动甚至是这次的瘟疫（新冠病毒），传统媒体，社交媒体，自媒体都沉浸在他们共建的媒体图景之中，而对于一个体，不再有能力通过媒体看到社会真相，一方面是信息的流通方式的巨变，另一方面是现在媒体状况的急剧恶化，这是媒体的盛宴，也是媒体的末日。
description_en: Social movements, even the plague of this time (COVID-19), traditional media, social media, and self-media, all indulge in the media landscape they have co-created. For an individual, there is no longer the ability to see the social truth through the media; on one hand is the huge change in the way information circulates, on the other hand is the rapid deterioration of the current media situation. It is both a feast and an apocalypse for the media.

title: Totem
description_cn: 高度信息化的新族群的图腾
description_en: Highly informative new ethnic totem

title: typeface
materials: USB installation, 10' LED screen, typeface file, wallpaper
description_cn: 没有含义的字体:利用人工神经网络算法教机器学习书法。作品是与圈圈共同完成。typeface 是一项艺术实验，旨在探索古老的文字，在通过数字化手段不断重复解构、重构的过程中意义的丧失。
description_en: Meaningless font: created by a deep convolutional generative adversarial network (DCGAN) trained on calligraphy collection. Made possible with the collaboration of Quanquan. Typeface is an art experiment, aims to explore the ancient text, in the digital means by repeating the process of deconstruction and reconstruction of the loss of meaning.

title: Sacpe.data
description_en: Conceptualized by aaajiao and yang2 with sound composition by yang2. This work displays a 15-minute video or live performance that intertwines computer graphics and video editing, all executed by aaajiao.

title: aaajiao: ‘Cybernetics’ exhibition catalog
description_en: This catalog reflects works from the Cybernetics series, made by the artist in 2009 and 2010, aiming to systematically examine the ways of thinking, art-making, expressing, and presenting from a young media artist's perspective. It illustrates the artist's unique construction methods and the artistic conversion of knowledge in specific fields.

description_en: A performance artwork conceptualized by aaajiao and zhang jian, featuring sound design from zhang jian associated with fm3 and incorporating computer graphics by aaajiao.

title: blogArchaeological 0
description_cn: 使用电子秤为 Jorn Barger所建立的 RobotWisdom.com 的数据称重，选择RobotWisdom.com不仅是因为Jorn Barger创造了weblog一词，而是他本人除了是一名程序员之外还是未来派艺术家和詹姆斯•乔伊斯研究者，其blog内容更私人，涉及的信息更为广泛，且blog运行至今。为其称重，是试图探究数据的衡量标准在最传统的度量衡制度下表现，以此为引子研究数据的永恒性。
description_en: Weigh the data involved in RobotWisdom.com. The choice of the site is not only because his author Jorn Barger created the word weblog, but also because he is a programmer, artist and expert at the same time. His blog is more personal oriented, its contents cover a wider field and are still running today. Weighting is to try to explore how measure standard of data represents under the most traditional metrology system. Making it an opening words, we study the permanence of data.

title: landscape004.gif

description_en: This artwork is a digital animation displayed on an LED screen, reflecting on the relationship between nature and technology. Measuring 64 x 128 x 6 cm, it was created between 2019 and 2020 and is part of an ongoing exploration of landscape in a digital age.
